New Records: Spain became the first team to record a 100 per cent record after three matches at Euro 2024.
Key Match Events: Ferran Torres scored his 20th international goal to give Spain a first-half lead.
Dani Olmo provided an assist for Torres' goal with a well-constructed pass.
Pre-Game Insights: Spain's manager Luis de la Fuente made 10 changes to the starting XI, a significant rotation in the tournament's history.
Post-Match Reflections: Spain's victory underlined their credentials as a team with quality and depth.
De la Fuente praised the spirit and commitment within the squad.
Albania was eliminated from the tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was only the third time in the tournament’s history a manager had altered the starting XI so significantly.
Spain's next match will be in Cologne against one of the four best third-placed teams on June 30.
